User Story: As a user, I want to use a character creation wizard to build my character step by step.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `CharacterCreationWizard` component guides the user through distinct steps (e.g., Basic Info, Attributes, Skills, Description).
Users can navigate forward and backward between steps.
Progress is visually indicated throughout the creation process.
The wizard saves progress at each step.
Completed character is saved to the character list when finished.

User Story: As a user, I want to assign attribute points to customize my character's abilities.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `AttributeAssignment` component allows users to allocate points within the min/max values defined by the world.
The interface shows remaining points as they are allocated.
The interface prevents allocating more points than available.
Users can reset allocations and start over.
Point assignments are validated before proceeding.

User Story: As a user, I want to select and rate skills to define my character's capabilities.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `SkillAssignment` component allows users to select skills defined by the world.
Users can assign ratings to skills within allowed ranges.
The interface enforces any skill selection limits.
Users can remove or change selections before finalizing.
Skill selections are validated before proceeding.

User Story: As a user, I want to enter descriptions for my character's appearance and personality.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `CharacterDescription` component provides text input fields for appearance, personality, and background.
Character descriptions are properly formatted and displayed on the character sheet.
The interface validates that required fields are completed.
Text fields support multi-paragraph entries.
Character text appears in a readable format in the final character sheet.

User Story: As a user, I want validation to ensure my character meets world requirements.
Acceptance Criteria:
Basic validation prevents proceeding if required fields are empty.
Attribute allocations are validated against world-defined min/max values.
Skill selections are validated against world-defined constraints.
Clear error messages indicate what needs to be fixed.
The final character cannot be saved until all validation passes.

User Story: As a user, I want to view a list of my created characters with basic information.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `CharacterList` component displays a list of created characters.
Each list item shows at least character name and world.
Characters are loaded from persistent storage when the page loads.
The list displays the creation date for each character.
Users can select a character from the list for detailed view or gameplay.

User Story: As a user, I want to edit my existing characters to update their details.
Acceptance Criteria:
An editing interface allows modification of existing character fields.
The editing interface reuses the same validation as character creation.
Changes are saved immediately when submitted.
The interface provides clear feedback when changes are saved.
Users can cancel edits without saving changes.

User Story: As a user, I want to delete characters I no longer need with proper confirmation.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `DeleteCharacterDialog` component prompts for confirmation before deletion.
Deleted characters are permanently removed from storage.
The character list updates immediately after deletion.
The interface provides feedback when deletion is complete.
Users can cancel the deletion process.

User Story: As a user, I want to view a detailed character sheet that shows all my character's information.
Acceptance Criteria:
The `CharacterSheet` component displays all core character information.
Information is organized in logical sections (basic info, attributes, skills, background).
The layout uses visual hierarchy to emphasize important details.
Character descriptions are displayed with proper formatting.
The character sheet provides access to editing functionality.

User Story: As a user, I want all character interfaces to work well on different screen sizes.
Acceptance Criteria:
All character interface components are responsive.
The interfaces are usable on mobile, tablet, and desktop screen sizes.
Layout adapts appropriately to available screen space.
Touch interactions work properly on mobile devices.
Font sizes and spacing adjust for readability on all devices.
